definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: Ostracized by the community for immoral activities.
sentences.chinese: 因爲道德敗壞的行爲被社會所排斥。

sentences.english: Absolute military power tends to deprave these which are not in control.
sentences.chinese: 軍事專權往往會使掌權的人道德敗壞。

sentences.english: There's nothing in the world so demoralizing as money.
sentences.chinese: 世上沒有任何東西比金錢更能使人道德敗壞。

sentences.english: And can you be immoral in a dream?
sentences.chinese: 你在夢境裏是否道德敗壞？

sentences.english: Of moral decay and corrupt officials, even you were not to look at.
sentences.chinese: 對道德敗壞者和貪官污吏，連看也不要看。

sentences.english: Absolute military power tends to deprave those who are not in control.
sentences.chinese: 軍事專權往往會使掌權的人道德敗壞。

sentences.english: She has degenerated into license and immorality.
sentences.chinese: 她已墮落到放縱和道德敗壞。

sentences.english: Absolute military power tends to deprave those who are in control.
sentences.chinese: 軍事專權往往會使掌權的人道德敗壞。
